standup.title: Shakespearean Standup
standup.summary: Write a poem about the things you did yesterday, you are going to do today and your blockers.
standup.description: You're allowed to use simple poems like the classic "roses are red", "Mary had a little lamb", or go ludicrous like a true William Shakespeare and baffle your teammates with your extensive vocabulary.
benefits: Poems are easy to remember, so teammates will likely (finally) remember what you told during the standup.
Better vocabulary; it let's you think about different words to describe the topics you want to discuss.
You can discover your inner Shakespeare!
